articles.title: The Stock Market Is the Greatest Wealth Generator Ever Devised. Here's Proof.
articles.content: The article discusses the long-term benefits of investing in the stock market, particularly through index funds and individual stocks. It presents a hypothetical scenario where an initial $10,000 investment in the S&P 500 ETF (SPY) grows significantly over 30 years, despite market downturns, highlighting the power of compounding and long-term investing.

articles.title: Here Are 2 Great Vanguard Dividend ETFs: Which Is Right For You?
articles.content: The article compares two Vanguard dividend ETFs - the High Dividend Yield ETF and the Dividend Appreciation ETF. It discusses the differences in their investment approaches and which one may be better suited for different investor goals and risk tolerances.

articles.title: If You'd Invested $10,000 in Berkshire Hathaway Stock 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
articles.content: Investing $10,000 in Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) 10 years ago would have grown to $31,797, a 12.26% annual average return, outperforming the S&P 500. However, Berkshire's growth has slowed in recent years due to its large size, and future returns may be in the 8-10% range.
